snippet: Solutions that would lower the federal prison population include repealing mandatory minimum sentences and reducing drug prosecutions.
abstract: Editorial criticizes the Justice Department report calling for reforms to make public expenditures on prisons smarter and more productive for failing to address sentencing changes that would significantly reduce the problem of overincarceration; contends that mandatory minimum sentences are a major contributor to the overcrowding in prisons and should be repealed.
lead_paragraph: Solutions that would lower the federal prison population include repealing mandatory minimum sentences and reducing drug prosecutions.
